description: From French arrestation, from Latin arrestatio.

entries.meaning: The act of stopping or slowing something (especially a process).
(dated) The act of catching someone's attention.
examples: Different hypnotists use different methods of inducing this condition, but the main factor in all of them is the fixation and arrestation of the attention and the use of suggestion.

entries.meaning: (dated) The act of arresting someone (taking them into legal custody).
